basics.name: Odinakachukwu Francis Ogoke
basics.label: Postdoctoral Associate
basics.summary: Researcher specializing in deep learning for additive manufacturing characterization and control, focusing on generative modeling, reinforcement learning, and computer vision.

work.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
work.summary: Researching advanced machine learning techniques for additive manufacturing.
highlights: Advised by Faez Ahmed and John Hart.

work.name: Apple
work.summary: Developed machine learning surrogate models for sheet metal forming finite element analysis (FEA).
highlights: Improved generalization performance for new geometries.

work.name: Carnegie Mellon University
work.summary: Led teaching team for a machine learning and AI course.
highlights: Organized a team of 10 TAs for a course with 120 students.
Developed assignments and exams for machine learning concepts.

courses: Deep Learning for Characterization and Control of Laser Powder Bed Fusion

awards.title: CMU College of Engineering Presidential Fellowship
Meta Uniting Scholars in Research Participant

publications.name: Generative Super-Resolution for In-Situ Layerwise Optical Imaging
Deep Learning for Melt Pool Depth Contour Prediction
Inexpensive High Fidelity Melt Pool Models in Additive Manufacturing Using Generative Deep Diffusion
